byline.contributor: Dan Barry reported from Orlando, and Serge F. Kovaleski, Alan Blinder and Mujib Mashal from Fort Pierce, Fla. Reporting was contributed by Frances Robles from Orlando; Daniel Ruetenik and Deborah Acosta from Fort Pierce; Kitty Bennett from St. Petersburg, Fla.; Richard A. Oppel Jr., Susan Campbell Beachy, Jack Begg, Robin Stein and Alain Delaquérière from New York; and Eric Lichtblau from Washington.
byline.original: By DAN BARRY, SERGE F. KOVALESKI, ALAN BLINDER and MUJIB MASHAL

abstract: Recollections of those who knew Orlando, Fla, nightclub shooter Omar Mateen paint portrait of awkward and perpetually angry man; Mateen's documented aggressiveness appears to have been problem since childhood.
lead_paragraph: The recollections of those who knew Omar Mateen or encountered him conjure a man forever aggrieved; forever not at peace; forever out of step.

headline.main: ‘Always Agitated. Always Mad’: Omar Mateen, According to Those Who Knew Him
headline.print_headline: From Troubled Child to Aggrieved Killer

snippet: The recollections of those who knew Omar Mateen or encountered him conjure a man forever aggrieved; forever not at peace; forever out of step.
